com.parse4cn1.util

Class ParseRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parse4cn1.util.ParseRegistry

  • public class ParseRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a registry for ParseObject (sub-)classes to facilitate their instantiation at runtime.

    Note that since CN1 does not support Java Reflection, custom ParseObject sub-classes need to be manually registered here using registerParseFactory(java.lang.String, com.parse4cn1.Parse.IParseObjectFactory) and registerSubclass(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParseRegistry()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getClassName(java.lang.Class<? extends ParseObject> clazz)
      Retrieves the class name associated with the provided ParseObject sub-class.
      static Parse.IParseObjectFactory getObjectFactory(java.lang.String className)
      Retrieves the object factory for instantiating objects of the class with the specified name.
      static void registerDefaultSubClasses()
      Registers predefined Parse classes like _User and _Role so that they can be instantiated when needed.
      static void registerExternalizableClasses()
      Registers all externalizable classes defined in the parse4cn1 library.
      static void registerParseFactory(java.lang.String className, Parse.IParseObjectFactory factory)
      Registers the factory to be used to instantiate object of className.
      static void registerSubclass(java.lang.Class<? extends ParseObject> subclass, java.lang.String className)
      Registers the ParseObject subclass associated with a given class name.
      static void reset()
      Resets all registered class mappings.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParseRegistry

        public ParseRegistry()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Resets all registered class mappings.

        Note that registered externalizable classes are not deregistered as that is not supported.

      • registerDefaultSubClasses

        public static void registerDefaultSubClasses()
        Registers predefined Parse classes like _User and _Role so that they can be instantiated when needed.

      • registerExternalizableClasses

        public static void registerExternalizableClasses()
        Registers all externalizable classes defined in the parse4cn1 library.

        Note: User-defined externalizable custom types stored in ParseObject or any of its sub-classes must be registered by the user otherwise persistence of any ParseObject containing such custom types will fail.

      • registerParseFactory

        public static void registerParseFactory(java.lang.String className,
                                        Parse.IParseObjectFactory factory)
        Registers the factory to be used to instantiate object of className.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the ParseObject sub-class to be associated with factory.
        factory - The factory to be used to instantiate objects of class className.

      • registerSubclass

        public static void registerSubclass(java.lang.Class<? extends ParseObject> subclass,
                                    java.lang.String className)
        Registers the ParseObject subclass associated with a given class name.
        Parameters:
        subclass - The ParseObject subclass.
        className - The class name associated with subClass.

      • getClassName

        public static java.lang.String getClassName(java.lang.Class<? extends ParseObject> clazz)
        Retrieves the class name associated with the provided ParseObject sub-class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A ParseObject sub-class.
        Returns:
        The class name associated with clazz or null if none is defined.

      • getObjectFactory

        public static Parse.IParseObjectFactory getObjectFactory(java.lang.String className)
        Retrieves the object factory for instantiating objects of the class with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        className - The class name whose object factory is required.
        Returns:
        The object factory for className. If none has been defined, the Parse.DefaultParseObjectFactory is returned.
